ags:resource.dc:title: DIGITAL CARTOGRAPHICAL MODELING OF DENSITY OF SEGMENTS OF THE GEOGRAPHICAL NEIGHBORING OF SPATIAL ORGANIZATION OF THE LANDSCAPE COMPONENTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PHYSICAL AND GEOGRAPHICAL ZONING OF NATURAL RESOURCES (ON THE EXAMPLE OF LESSER CAUCASUS WITHIN B

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Unlike other indexes of spatial organization of landscape components geographical borders are very significant for determination of the level of differentiation of territorial indexes of the nature components on the studied territory.

ags:resource.dc:title: DIGITAL MATHEMATICAL AND CARTOGRAPHICAL MODELING OF SPATIAL CONSTRUCTION OF SOIL IN ORDER TO ENSURE RATIONAL NATURE MANAGEMENT (ON EXAMPLE OF AZERBAIJAN TERRITORY)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article authors consider methods of creation of the digital map of spatial distribution of segments of the soil geographical neighboring on the territory of the Azerbaijan Republic. Authors also present digital mathematical- cartographical models of the spatial soil cover structure made with the help of the SURFER8 software.

ags:resource.dc:title: FUNDAMENTAL BASES OF SCIENCES ON GEOMETRY OF GEO-RESOURCES

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author presents fundamental basics of sciences connected with geometry of geo-resources. The author describes their historical development in the mining and geological sciences. First statements and provisions about the necessity to apply geometry for understanding the subsurface resources are stated.

ags:resource.dc:title: GEO-DRIFTOGENAL CONCEPT OF GEO-MORPHOGENESIS OR GEO-MORPHOLOGIC MODEL OF MOBILISM

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article is dedicated to the attempt to supply the stagnation observed in theoretical geomorphology, arising in connection with the fiasco of the teaching about geosinclinals predominant in geotectonics. To solve this problem the new geomorphological concept – the geodriftogenal concept of relief evolution is suggested on the basis of the plate tectonics theory.

ags:resource.dc:title: GEOINFORMATIONAL MODELING OF NATURAL CONDITIONS OF CATCHMENT BASINS OF MOUNTAIN RIVERS FOR CAUSATIVE ANALYSIS OF THE RIVER RUNOFF CHANGES (ON THE EXAMPLE OF LESSER CAUCASUS WITHIN BORDERS OF AZERBAIJAN)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article authors describe methods of geoinformational modeling of indexes of natural conditions of river catchment basins for the purpose of the causative analysis. Authors consider the degree of variability of indexes of the river runoff in space and time on example river basins of Lesser Caucasus within the Azerbaijan borders.

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Goriklaustmonitogrammes – biolocational hermeneutic apparels of energy-informational plesio-anthropometric regular consortiums of pangeotic and cosmosidereal gravitational system-apophycations. Mechanisms of regulation include anabiotic and graviphlegmatic accommodations of breeding auto-somatic apologist: auto-gemareconic extrapolations; bifurcation extrephylogemaes; anthropogenesis; auto-segregation of topographical locuses; transcontinental autogenesis; passionate reducts; heraldic metamorphosis; catasonic polikorts; auto-gearctic polisoms; democytosic recital apotheosis; partnergenesis.

ags:resource.dc:title: IMPROVEMENT OF THE METHOD OF DETERMINATION OF CADASTRAL VALUE OF AGRICULTURAL LANDS IN THE REPUBLIC OF KAZAKHSTAN

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Transition to market economy and the land reform have brought the formation of the land and real estate market. Land as the non-renewable and limited resource is always valuable. Land market is a combination of various land-related transactions. All transactions are possible only in case of presence of the price for the land. Hence the actuality of the land assessment understood (from economic point of view) as the result of systematic collection and analysis of data necessary for precise determination of the cost of lands used for various purposes in accordance with the active legislation.

ags:resource.dc:title: LANDSCAPE-ECOLOGICAL OPTIMIZATION OF GEO-SYSTEMS OF INTERMONTANE TROUGHS IN AZERBAIJAN REPUBLIC

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article the author analyzes main features of landscape-ecological optimization of agricultural landscapes of intermontane troughs of the Azerbaijan Republic. On the basis of space photographs the author determines main patterns of differentiation of modern naturally-anthropogenic landscapes and considers matters of regulation and rational planning of anthropogenic complexes as well as matters of creation of ecologically sustainable landscapes.

ags:resource.dc:title: MATHEMATICAL AND CARTOGRAPHICAL MODELING OF THE RELIEF FOR THE PURPOSE OF AGRICULTURAL TERRITORIAL PLANNING (ON EXAMPLE OF AZERBAIJAN TERRITORY)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Authors consider matters of digital PC-based mapping of differentiation of the spatial relief. Ways of using these maps in the agricultural territorial planning in Azerbaijan are presented. Еxamples of digital maps of the relief spatial differentiation in Azerbaijan territory are given.

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author considers the beginning of silvicultural works in Kazakhstan and emphasizes the data on dynamics of volumes of work on reproduction of forests in Kazakhstan in 1992-2010.

ags:resource.dc:title: ROLE OF COSMIC FORCES IN FORMATION OF LARGE-SCALE CIRCULATIONS IN OCEANS AND SEAS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author has shown that the daily impact of tide-forming forces exerted by the Moon and the Sun on water masses in the equatorial zone forms long-period Rossby waves with the resulting transferring from east to west. Wave flows reach continental shores and diverge northward and southward. Thus, separate anti-cyclonic circulations form in the northern and southern parts of the Atlantic, Indian, and Pacific oceans. The daily impact of tide-forming forces exerted by the Moon and the Sun on water masses outside the equatorial zone forms large-scale cyclonic circulation in the northern and southern parts of three oceans. The same circulations form in closed and border seas and large lakes.

ags:resource.dc:title: SOME GEOGRAPHIC REGULARITIES OF LOCATION OF CONSERVATION AREAS IN CIS ON THE BASIS OF LANDSCAPE TYPES

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article is devoted to examination of regularities in location of conservation areas on the basis of landscape types formed in territories of the Commonwealth of Independent States. It is obvious that conservation areas formed in the territory of the former USSR were located irregularly according to the landscape types (within limits of natural zones). Numbers and areas of conservation areas formed in all natural zones were compared and the irregularity was found here as well. This fact was also studied while carrying out the analysis of separate natural zones.

ags:resource.dc:title: STUDY OF INDUSTRIAL SECTOR IN CITIES OF AZERBAIJAN AS A SOURCE OF ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author studied the industrial sector and environmental pollution caused by it. Interaction of this pollution with meteorological conditions in industrial cities of Azerbaijan has been determined and analyzed.

ags:resource.dc:title: STUDY OF RADON IN THE CITY OF KAZAN AND ITS OUTSKIRTS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In this paper the author presents measurements of the stream density and volume activity of the radon radiation in the soil in the territory of the city of Kazan and its outskirts. The author presents the analysis of measurement results, assessment of radon hazard on the territory as well as patterns of the radon concentration changes in the region under study.
